intro: Guatteria panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to Central America, particularly found in the tropical rainforests of Panama and parts of Colombia. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale green. Its fruit is a globose berry that turns from green to yellow or orange when mature. Guatteria panamensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for various wildlife species.
